org.fishwife.jrugged.spring.jmx

Class WebMBeanServerAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fishwife.jrugged.spring.jmx.WebMBeanServerAdapter

  • public class WebMBeanServerAdapter
extends Object
    The WebMBeanServerAdapter provides access to MBeans managed by an MBeanServer via simple string-based accessor methods. This is particularly useful for implementing a web interface to interact with the MBeans. Names of MBeans and returned values are sanitized using the MBeanStringSanitizer to make them HTML-friendly. It should be noted that creating a web interface the JMX beans bypasses the JMX security mechanisms that are built into the JVM. If there is a need to limit access to the JMX beans then the web interface will need to be secured.

    • Method Detail

      • getMBeanNames

        public Set<String> getMBeanNames()

        Returns:

      • createWebMBeanAdapter

        public WebMBeanAdapter createWebMBeanAdapter(String mBeanName,
                                             String encoding)
                                      throws JMException,
                                             UnsupportedEncodingException
        Create a WebMBeanAdaptor for a specified MBean name.
        Parameters:
        mBeanName - the MBean name (can be URL-encoded).
        encoding - the string encoding to be used (i.e. UTF-8)
        Returns:
        the created WebMBeanAdaptor.
        Throws:
        JMException - Java Management Exception
        UnsupportedEncodingException - if the encoding is not supported.
